meanings.definition: To divide into three equal parts.
meanings.sent1: She will trisect the cake for the party.
meanings.sent2: The teacher showed us how to trisect a line in geometry class.
meanings.sent3: Trying to trisect a single cookie was a fun challenge.
meanings.sent4: The river seemed to trisect the forest as it flowed through.
meanings.sent5: The magician's wand could trisect anything with a wave.

meanings.definition: To cut or split into three parts.
meanings.sent1: He decided to trisect the sandwich for his three friends.
meanings.sent2: The carpenter needed to trisect the wooden plank evenly.
meanings.sent3: The chef attempted to trisect the giant watermelon.
meanings.sent4: The lightning seemed to trisect the sky with its bright flash.
meanings.sent5: The sword was sharp enough to trisect the enemy's armor.
